board.name: power
board.test: Check that all the 5V output pins are connected to the 5V supply.
Check that all the ground output pins are connected to ground.
Power the board's 3.3V rail. Check it doesn't draw too much current.
Power the board's 5V rail (at the same time as 3.3V). Check it doesn't draw too much current.
Connect to the MSP430. Program it.
Read the correct board identity over I2C.
Check the I2C LED flashes during I2C transactions.
Check that the LCD can display text. Write a test string to it.
Press the screen-change button. Check it works.
Short each PWM output to its associated 5V output. Use a jumper. Check that nothing explodes.
Short each PWM output to its associated ground output. Use a jumper. Check that nothing explodes.
Connect a servo to each output in turn. Move it from one extreme to the other by changing the PWM output. Also move it to one position in-between.
Disconnect the 3.3V power. Make nothing current limits.
